story.text: (Adds merger details, stock prices)NEW YORK Jan 2 (Reuters) - CheckFree Corp. CKFR.O, a maker of software for online bill paying, said on Tuesday it agreed to buy Carreker Corp. CANI.O for $206 million to expand its payment processing and consulting services to the financial industry. The terms value Carreker at $8.05 per share, a 5 percent premium over the stock's Friday closing price of $7.64 on Nasdaq. CheckFree said the acquisition combines its payment processing services with Carreker's ability to capture and process digital images of paper checks. It said the combined company will be able to convert paper checks into electronic items earlier in the payment process. The company will serve substantially all of the 100 largest U.S. banks, CheckFree said. CheckFree expects the purchase to dilute earnings per share in its fiscal 2007 year, which ends June 30, and in fiscal 2008. It expects the transaction to close by March 31, pending shareholder and regulatory approvals. CheckFree will finance the purchase with cash and revolving credit. CheckFree is based in Atlanta, and Carreker in Dallas. CheckFree shares closed Friday at $40.16 on the Nasdaq.
story.title: update 1 - checkfree to buy carreker for $ 206 mln
